If he lives with his parents for longer time, they have more chances to share the feelings, exercise, and travel together. All memories become priceless treasure as time passes by. Thus, I think undergoing with parents is worthwhile.Furthermore, living at home costs less than living outside. Learning to be independent means that the young adult needs to leave home. Therefore, he may have to rent a house and the rental would become a burden for parents. Moreover, another daily expense is also the considerable outgoings. Spending much money may not result in what the parents expect their children to be. In a word, the parents can save money, if their children live with them longer.The third convincing reason is that the young adult needs father and mother's suggestions. When in dilemma, the parents can comfort him and give him a big hand. They are the people who are most familiar with him can give a suitable advice and lead him to the right way. If the parents do not help him immediately, he would have to suffer more pain. Hence, taking advice from parents, the young adult can go through obstacles easily.To sum up, living with parents longer brings about memories with parents, less cost, and advice from parents. Hence, staying longer with parents is a better choice.
llm: The ongoing discussion about whether young adults should pursue independence from their parents at an early age or remain living with their families for an extended period has garnered significant attention. Personally, I contend that staying with family for a longer duration offers greater advantages for young adults.On one hand, residing with parents can afford young adults financial stability and security. For example, many universities and colleges mandate that students have a permanent address, which can easily be fulfilled by living at home. Moreover, parents can provide vital emotional support and guidance, assisting their children in navigating the complexities of young adulthood. For instance, a young adult pursuing higher education may draw valuable insights and experience from their parents when making crucial life decisions.Conversely, seeking independence too soon can result in unnecessary stress and challenges. Numerous young adults who leave their parents' homes prematurely find themselves grappling with financial issues, such as covering rent and bills, which may force them to sacrifice their educational or career aspirations. For instance, a young adult juggling a part-time job to make ends meet may lack the time or energy needed to explore their passions or interests.In conclusion, while the pursuit of independence is a vital aspect of maturation, I assert that residing with family longer can supply young adults with the necessary support and stability to thrive. By staying with their parents, young adults can concentrate on their educational and career objectives without the weight of financial strain, while also benefiting from the love and wisdom of their family. Ultimately, this arrangement can pave the way for a more successful and fulfilling life.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the statement that a zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and example to explain your answer.
human: Some people may believe that a zoo is futile in the era of globalization, which people can develop their knowledge fast and easily. However, I do not agree with them. I believe that the zoo is invaluable for human beings. It is very crucial for learning. It helps animals out of extinction. Also, it is a interesting travel location.First of all, the zoo gives humans new knowledge. When you were so young that you did not know many kinds of animals, what should you do if there were no zoo? Inevitably, the zoo is the important place for innate learning. The zoo also let students have a chance to learning biology practically. They are able to observe animals' behaviors and features. Moreover, practical learning help students relax from a boring lecture class. Besides, researchers need the zoo to pick up some examples of animals for their researches because it has diverse species of animals.Secondly, the zoo preserves a large number of rare animals and provides them safe habitats. In the zoo, there is not so harmful as a forest. They, fed by zookeepers, do not need to find food themselves. Furthermore, we can do artificial insemenation to maintain nearly extinct wildlife.Last but not least, because of all weird, acute, and beautiful animals in the zoo, it can be a great tourist attraction. There are a lot of tourists who seek to see those animals closely. If the zoo has a large number of both national and foreign tourists, it will receive a great deal of money. That also make money flow, and then economics become better. It benefits to a certain country. In conclusion, the zoo not only saves animals in danger of extinction, but also helps people around the world have better lives. I firmly believe that the zoo is so useful for the earth.
llm: I contest the notion that zoos serve no valuable purpose. While some may perceive them simply as entertainment venues, I argue that they are essential for conservation, education, and research. A key function of a zoo is to create a secure environment for endangered species, which frequently face threats from habitat loss, pollution, and poaching. For example, the giant panda breeding programs in zoos have successfully bolstered the population of this beloved species, which was once on the verge of extinction.Moreover, zoos function as educational centers where visitors can discover the significance of conservation and the effects of human activities on the natural world. Many zoos provide interactive exhibits and programs designed to raise awareness about the struggles faced by various species and the necessity of protecting their habitats. The conservation initiatives at the San Diego Zoo, for instance, have informed millions of visitors about the importance of preserving polar bears and their environments, which are currently at risk due to climate change.Additionally, zoos offer a platform for scientific research, which can guide conservation efforts and enhance our understanding of animal behavior, physiology, and ecology. By observing animals in regulated settings, zoos assist researchers in devising effective conservation strategies and enhancing the management of wild populations. The examination of animal behavior within zoos has aided scientists in developing more successful reintroduction programs for species such as wolves and bears.In summary, I strongly assert that zoos have a significant purpose, encompassing conservation, education, and research. By providing a safe refuge for endangered species, enlightening visitors about conservation efforts, and fostering scientific inquiry, zoos greatly contribute to biodiversity preservation and the safeguarding of our planet's cherished wildlife. Far from lacking a useful purpose, zoos play an integral role in promoting animal welfare and the overall health of our environment.

question: Parents are the best teacher for young children. To what extend do you argee or disagree?
human: It is obvious that parents are the first teachers who teach babies how to walk and speak and make children to become a good person. Moreover, parents provide their children the best social skills and knowledge in order to prepare for their children's future life.First, children are taught basic things, which influence their whole life, by their parents. As a baby, they do not know any thing all around but they learn everything from their parents. Parents always try to explain and describe tenderly all things in simple way so that their baby can understand and learn from that. Consequently, parents bring the whole world of wonderful and colorful thing into their baby's little mind.Second, parents train their child how to become a good person. They always make their children basically say thanks and apology in the right way. On the one hand, it is common that they try to explain who is a good or bad person. On the other hand, children are shown how to behave well with others. This seems to be easy but this can influence positively their future children and makes children's behavior better before they face the real world.Third, it is clear that parents are ones who loves their children most and always take care of their children. Thus, they tend to provide the best knowledge and advice from their experience for children. Unlike a professional, parents always support children and give them much social skill so they can communicate well with others and have good habit in life. In fact, parents' support is one factor which makes people succeed in their life.In conclusion, parents are really the best teachers who give us much knowledge and advice. Based on love, they always try their best to make good condition for their children development in order to prepare children's future life.
llm: The idea that parents serve as the best educators for young children has gained considerable attention in recent years. Some believe parents are crucial to a child's educational development, while others argue that professional teachers are more qualified to deliver a well-rounded education. I partially agree that parents are indeed the best teachers for young children.On one hand, parents have a distinct advantage in their ability to teach due to the deep bond and trust they share with their children. They can provide personalized attention, which is especially beneficial for young learners who need guidance and support during their formative years. Furthermore, parents are uniquely positioned to instill essential values, morals, and cultural norms, all of which are vital for the child's social and emotional growth.Conversely, parents may lack the necessary skills or expertise to teach certain subjects as children advance in their education. Professional educators, having undergone extensive training, possess the knowledge required to offer a comprehensive educational experience. Additionally, teachers are better equipped to identify and address learning challenges and to create a structured, disciplined learning environment that promotes academic achievement.In summary, while parents play a crucial role in the early education of their children, I believe they are not the sole or necessarily the best educators. A collaborative model, where parents and professional teachers work in tandem, is likely to produce the most favorable outcomes for children. By fostering a supportive and nurturing environment, and harnessing the strengths of both parents and educators, we can provide young children with a well-rounded education that sets them up for future success. Ultimately, the combination of parental love and professional teaching is the key to achieving the most effective learning results.

question: Some people say that television has a bad influence to young children. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays, we have undergone many technology innovations such as Tv. Many people say that television has negative effects on children, since it can be violent or inappropriate for children. However, I strongly believe that television has more positive effects than negative effects. There are two reasons to support my idea.First of all, television has useful and educational programs. Not only the up-to-date news, but also there are many programs which has educational purposes. If children can use those programs wisely, they can learn many information from it. For example, in Korea, there's program called EBS. It is targeted for children to teenager. We can study subjects through EBS lecture. Also, there are many documentary films such as the life of a great man in Korea. Using those education programs let people get a lot of inspirations instead of having negative effects. In addition, Tv is helpful to relieve our stresses. There are many Tv programs such as sports programs. Many children have a lot of stresses recently, since they have so much pressure about study. When they are watching sports programs, it's easy to relieve those stresses. As an example, I got too much stress from the school. So, I was quite aggressive, however. After I watch the soccer match between Korea and Japan, the stress was gone. Instead, this soccer match helped me to continue my academic career in the school, since it helped me to relieve my stress.In conclusion, of course, the television can have violent programs, however, if children can use Tv programs wisely, there are more positive effects than negative effects. Now that, it has useful and educational programs and quite helpful to relieve stresses for children. For these reasons, I strongly disagree with the statement that television has negative effects on children.
llm: The effects of television on young children have long been a matter of concern. While some people believe that television negatively impacts children, I contend that excessive viewing can indeed harm their development.On one hand, television can serve as a valuable tool for education and entertainment. Numerous programs, such as Sesame Street and National Geographic, offer children important knowledge and skills. Additionally, television can introduce young viewers to various cultures, traditions, and lifestyles, enhancing their understanding of the world.Conversely, too much television exposure can result in several adverse effects. For example, viewing violent or aggressive content may encourage similar behaviors in children. Moreover, spending excessive time in front of the screen can promote a sedentary lifestyle, leading to obesity and other health issues. Advertising on television can also push unhealthy foods and products, shaping children’s eating habits and consumer choices.In summary, while television has the potential to be a beneficial resource for children, I believe that excessive viewing poses significant risks. Parents and caregivers should supervise children's television consumption and prioritize educational and informative programming. By doing so, we can reduce the negative impacts of television while enhancing its benefits. Ultimately, a balanced and mindful approach to television viewing is crucial for fostering healthy development and well-being in children.

question: Businesses should hire employees for their entire lives. Do you agree or disagree. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.Ê
human: Many entrepreneurs hypothesize that it is safer to hire employees for their entire lives in order to ensure the productivity and efficiency of working. From my perspective, those assumptions are not only conservative but also out-of-date. I am biased towards the opposite side that businesses had better not employ the workers for the whole of their life because of the three main crucial reasons. First and foremost, various ideas and creativity from different people are indispensable for a company to flourish. The invaluable experience of senior employees can pass down to the young apprentices who get used to new job, but regularly give out creative and novel ideas. What's more, the rapid development in every field nowadays requires precise updates and access to new knowledge. Therefore, the youngsters are capable of meeting those standards. More importantly, they have activeness, inventiveness and enterprise which allow them to complete their jobs perfectly. These vital factors can decide whether the company can thrive or not.Secondly, the staff soon gets boring with their stable job in such a long time. At a certain time, they may presume that a securing job is the most important and necessary because they need to earn money to manage their life. Thereafter, the bulk of them realize that high promotion and competition can assist them to improve their skills and horizons also. Many people enjoy challenging them because they don not want to be monotonous and passive ones. The same-old-same-old environment soon makes them depressed, so this situation will have an adverse impact on the enterprise. Last but not least, the economic crisis and financial recession result in a tremendous increase in unemployment. In my opinion, the businesses ought to recruit many workers so as to tackle this aching issue. It enables the jobless to better their life and earn a living. Furthermore, the factories and companies will have abundant human sources to ensure the pace of manufacture and also devising lots of unique ideas. In a nutshell, varied characteristics of various people, feeling tired of having the same occupation and solving the unemployed problem drive me to agree with the statement that the employer should not hire the staff for a whole life. I believe that the brilliant bosses are conscious of the need for giving opportunities to diverse employees.
llm: I take issue with the idea that companies should employ individuals for their entire careers. Although job security is important, lifetime employment can produce adverse effects for both employers and employees.One major concern is that it can foster complacency among staff. When employees believe their jobs are permanent, they may lack the motivation to innovate, refine their skills, or work effectively. For example, Japan's traditional lifetime employment system, which was once praised for promoting loyalty and commitment, has faced criticism for creating a complacent workforce.Additionally, lifetime employment can limit a company's capacity to adapt to evolving market demands. Businesses must be agile and responsive to changes in consumer preferences, technological advancements, and economic shifts. A lifetime employment policy might deter companies from letting go of underperforming staff or reorganizing their teams, even when such actions are vital for the company's survival. For instance, during the COVID-19 pandemic, many organizations swiftly altered their operations to remain viable, and those with flexible workforces were generally more successful in navigating the crisis compared to those bound by inflexible lifetime employment arrangements.Moreover, lifetime employment can stifle employees' career advancement and personal development. Being tethered to a single employer throughout one's career can result in missed opportunities for acquiring new experiences, honing skills, and progressing in one's profession. This stagnation can lead to dissatisfaction and decreased productivity among employees.In summary, while job security is vital, the concept of lifetime employment is not a practical or advantageous solution for employers or employees. Businesses should prioritize fostering a supportive and inclusive workplace that promotes employee growth, innovation, and fulfillment rather than committing to lifetime job guarantees.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Childhood is the happiest time of a person's life. Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
human: I agree with the statement that childhood is the happiest period of one's life. It's not only the lack of responsibilities and daily struggle that make childhood the happiest time of our lives, but also factors like learning lots of new things every day and freedom to imagine and say what you think.Starting with our adulthood, we are strictly bounded with our responsibilities in our daily lives. We are told at what hour we shall wake up, how we shall dress up and how we shall behave. Every action we make are watched closely and judged by the community. But during our childhood, though responsibilies exist, we are much more free to do what we would like to. Being late for school or laughing at a place where you aren't supposed to do not have consequences as serious as that would be if you were an adult. Another great thing about being a child is possibility learning new and interesting things about the world you live in every single day. Being a child means that you are new in this world and every single thing around you is there to be discovered by you. There are lots of new facts you can learn, stories you can listen to and things you can see. Therefore, childhood is the period of time in which a person is surprised most.Using your imagination and saying what you think freely is another great thing about being a child. Children are not judged about the things they say as much as the adults, and freedom to express yourself is a very important for developing a colorful imagination. In adulthood, people are forced to express themselves in boundaries, therefore they are in no way free to think or use their imagination.Childhood, in several aspects, is the happiest period of our lives. It's not only because of the nature of childhood and children, but also the way our lives are changed when we are adults. In an ideal world with less boundaries, social judgement and more freedom of thought, things could be different; but since this is not the case, it seems that we will always be missing our childhood days.
llm: I concur that childhood represents the happiest phase of a person’s life. During this time, individuals experience a sense of freedom and innocence that greatly enhances their happiness. Children are free from the burdens and stresses that come with adulthood—like financial responsibilities, job pressures, and complicated relationships. This liberation allows them to relish simple joys, such as playing with friends, reading, and exploring their environment, all without the weight of adult worries.Consider a child’s delight on their birthday or their sheer joy upon receiving a new toy. These experiences encapsulate genuine happiness and excitement, untainted by the intricacies of adult life. Moreover, children's constant learning and discovery instill in them a sense of wonder and anticipation. Their imaginations and creativity flourish, enabling them to dream big and envision endless possibilities.In stark contrast, as people age, they often become disillusioned and cynical, losing the sense of joy and wonder that characterized their childhood. The adult pressures can be overwhelming, leading to stress and anxiety that dent their happiness. Additionally, the loss of innocence and the harsh realities of the world contribute to a decline in overall contentment. For these reasons, I strongly assert that childhood is indeed the happiest time in a person's life—a period marked by unrestrained joy, curiosity, and freedom from adult complexities.

question: Learning about the past has no value on for those of us living the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people think that "Past has nothing to do with present, as time never stops, the next generations are completely different from the predecessors". Although it is true that life changes rapidly, there are many things in the past that we can learn about, such as mistakes, success and knowledge in many fields of study. First of all, the predecessors' mistakes are the first thing that we should consider when learning about the past. As everyone's life is too short to risk trying anything without any prepare, we all should learn about other's mistakes so that we can avoid making the same ones. Each mistake, from the smallest to the bigger one, is a treasure of experience, which, if we can make full use of, will make us well-prepared for many complicated situations of our life. Therefore, past obviously saves ourselves a bunch of failures and times.Secondly, people's success in the past is as significant as those mistakes. If the predecessors' mistakes are the indirect way that leads us to the goals, others' accomplishment can be served as the direct way. By looking into the ways other people use to achieve their targets, we have the chance to make those mine, put them into practice and, of course, be successful like them. For instance, Edison's statement "Genius is 1 percent inspiration and 99 percent perspiration" is still helpful for everyone today, and probably in the future. Last but not least, the past is the basis in which people can use to develope new knowledge, inventions. If it had not been for those knowledge in the past, we could never be as modern as today. How can America be the world's leading country if Columbus did not accidentally discover it in his search for India. How can the comtemporary scientists study the earth's gravity without the apple which fall on Newton's head. They are only some of many precious knowledge that the past presents us. We cannot ignore them in any way.All in all, the past's mistakes, success and knowledge all have crucial impact on people's lives today. We should make full use of the past, instead of ignoring it, for a better and brighter future.
llm: I completely reject the idea that studying history offers no value to those of us in the present. Understanding our past is crucial for navigating the complexities of today's world. By delving into history, we can uncover important insights into the roots and repercussions of major events, which can guide our present-day choices and actions.For example, the lessons derived from historical events such as World War II highlight the perils of nationalism, xenophobia, and totalitarianism. Additionally, the civil rights movement of the 1960s has fueled today's social justice movements, showcasing the strength of collective action and resilience amid challenges. By reflecting on these experiences, we can gain a richer understanding of the intricacies of human behavior, politics, and society.Moreover, historical awareness acts as a springboard for innovation and progress. Many contemporary technologies and scientific breakthroughs are built upon the foundations laid by previous discoveries and inventions. Take the internet, for instance; its development owes much to earlier advancements in computer networks and telecommunications. By examining the past, we can acknowledge the contributions of trailblazers and leverage their achievements to foster future innovations.In summary, learning about our history transcends mere academic inquiry; it is essential for effectively engaging with the present. It enriches our understanding of the world, influences our choices, and motivates us to create a better future. By embracing our collective history, we can cultivate a more informed, empathetic, and progressive society. Thus, I firmly believe that studying the past holds immense significance for those navigating the present.

question: Governments spent a lot of money for traveling outer space. Do you think the investment is reasonable? Give your own opinion and reasons to support you claim
human: Space exploration, for discovery of out of space, has been possible for human in the 20th century. The United state and Russia are the important countries that spend large budgets for the research of this subject. In my opinion, spending the budget for space exploration is an important activity to save living of humanity in the future. Many governments believe that space exploration is an activity that wastes the budget, while the essential challenge of humanity in the future would be the discovery of a new place for the living. In 20th century, although human being succeeded to achieve out of space by means of new technologies such as rockets, but finding a new place for living in another planet is impossible until now. In during history, our planet is threatening by many of other planets or stars and it is an enormous danger for living of humanity. Therefore, it is very significant to find a new place for living in other planets. Space exploration has used as a tools for military power in the cold war. In the future, many countries will try to prevent attach of other countries by using and invention new missiles. In the past, the space race happened between the United Stated and the Soviet Union. Both countries tried to send man to the moon and show their power to each other. As a result, space exploration will use as a military power for many countries.In summary, spending budget for space exploring is not the waste budget, because it may helps to save civilization of humanity. Although exploring space used for discovery of other planets, nowadays most of governments have used many rockets for military purposes and therefore the purposes of exploring space has altered.
llm: Governments' investments in space travel have ignited a vigorous debate in recent years. While some critics view it as a misallocation of resources, I am convinced that such investments are both reasonable and justified. The advantages of space exploration, in my view, significantly surpass the associated costs.To begin with, space exploration has led to a range of scientific advancements and innovations that enhance our everyday lives. A prime example is the development of GPS technology, which owes its existence to space research and has transformed how we navigate and communicate. Additionally, the exploration of space has propelled progress in various fields, including medicine, telecommunications, and environmental science.Furthermore, I believe that investing in space travel is prudent because it holds the potential to secure the long-term survival of humanity. As we confront environmental challenges and dwindling resources on Earth, space exploration could offer viable solutions. By investigating and possibly colonizing other planets, we can safeguard the future of our species and unlock new avenues for resource acquisition and economic development.Moreover, the investment in space travel has spurred the creation of new industries and job opportunities, contributing positively to the economy. The space industry is currently valued in the billions and is projected to expand dramatically in the coming years. This expansion not only promises new employment opportunities but also fosters innovation and entrepreneurial ventures.In summary, although the financial commitment to space travel may seem steep, I argue that it is a justifiable and essential investment for humanity's progress. The myriad benefits of space exploration, ranging from scientific advancements to economic development, make it a worthwhile endeavor. As we continue to explore the frontiers of space, we are likely to discover new opportunities and face challenges that will greatly influence the future of our planet and beyond.

question: Do you agree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.Ê
human: Television is one of the greatest innovations that we use every day. Besides, watching television has some cons and at the same time has very good pros. However, while some people argue that TV has devastated communication among friends and families, I believe it has done the opposite. I think TV programs are among the popular topics in every day talk as well as a great time for gathering. In addition Modern TV has smart system that let you be connected with people.First, it's true watching TV take a lot of your day, nevertheless it makes people meet and start a conversation about what they watch at other times like weather forecast and sport programs.Second, people like having meals while they are watching TV. Families usually tend to watch television either with each other or friends. For example my friends and I used to sit together and enjoy watching movies using VHS player at nights. It was fun and a little bit similar to the cinema. Third, TV can be one of communication ways. Moreover, TV can be connected to multimedia devices that have smart operating system like Google TV, WDTV using Skype, tango and other apps. In addition Teenagers can play games online with their friends; therefore we can communicate with each other through TV. To sum up, TV may take some of your time away from your family and friends but it can also make family get together and help to get in conversation. As well as it's one way of recent communications, based on that I think TV helps you to get connected with people.
llm: I have a mixed view on the claim that television has undermined communication among friends and family. While it's evident that excessive TV watching can impede face-to-face interactions, I don't believe it is the only factor contributing to the decline in communication.On one hand, television can indeed pose a barrier to meaningful interactions. When people come together in front of the screen, they often become absorbed in the program, watching in silence instead of connecting with one another. This can result in fewer deep, personal discussions and a feeling of emotional distance. For example, a family might spend an entire evening watching a movie without exchanging a single word, missing valuable opportunities to bond and express their thoughts and feelings.Conversely, television can also serve as a unifying force. Many people enjoy watching TV shows or sports events with their loved ones, creating shared experiences that can lead to lively conversations and a sense of togetherness. For instance, tuning into a major sporting event or a trending show can spark discussions and debates, ultimately strengthening relationships.In summary, although television can be a barrier to communication, it is not the only factor eroding communication among friends and family. It is essential for individuals to find a balance between screen time and engaging in meaningful conversations with those they care about. By being aware of our television consumption and making a conscious effort to interact with one another, we can ensure that TV enriches, rather than replaces, our human connections.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship.Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
human: There is an argument regrading weather letting a friend make a mistake is better than taking action that risks destroying a friendship. It is widely accepted by many people that a mistake will return sometimes terrible result. However, I believe that friendship is more important than mistake by a friend, although mistake is terrible. In this essay, I will present two reasons supporting my opinion. First of all, a mistake does not last for a long time but a friendship lasts forever. Anybody does not remember mistakes. If someone remembers mistake, he or she has a closed mind. I want to say that mistakes will be forgotten quickly. For example, my friend Lee made a mistake that he broke my precious gift. However, I forgot about it just after two days, and I felt at peace with him. Some people might say I am silly, but I think mistake is more forgettable than friendship. Second, Everybody makes mistake. However, if you end a friendship whenever your friend makes a mistake, there will be no friends around you. I agree if a friend makes very a big mistake, we will need to end a friendship. However, when the mistake friend made was not a big problem, we need to understand friend and forgive it because a friend is a gift of our life. According to a research, 85% of people answered that a best gift is a friend.I think that a mistake can not brake friendship if it is not a big because friendship is forever and gift our life.
llm: I believe that allowing a friend to make a mistake is often preferable to taking action that could jeopardize the friendship. While the desire to intervene and prevent a friend from making a poor choice can be strong, doing so can create feelings of resentment and harm the relationship. Friends cherish their independence, and being directed on what to do may come off as controlling or condescending.For example, if a friend is contemplating a dubious business venture, one might feel compelled to dissuade them. However, if they are set on proceeding, trying to intervene could provoke defensiveness and emotional hurt. By letting them make their own decision, even if it leads to a misstep, you provide them with an invaluable opportunity to learn and grow. This approach also conveys that you respect their judgment and trust their capacity to make choices.Furthermore, taking steps to prevent a friend from erring can diminish their confidence and self-esteem. When they sense that you don’t trust them to make sound decisions, it can cause them to question their abilities, which ultimately erodes their sense of independence. By allowing friends to navigate their own mistakes, we affirm our belief in their capabilities and show that we are willing to support them, even in their misjudgments. This approach not only fortifies the friendship but also fosters personal growth through shared experiences. In summary, although it can be challenging to allow a friend to stumble, it is often more beneficial for the friendship than taking action that may lead to its unraveling.

question: One of the best ways that parents can help their teenage children prepare for adult life is to encourage them to take a part-time job.
human: Nowadays, the society has become exceedingly competitive than ever before, parents have the responsibilitis to teach their children to survive and to be indepedent from them, just as animals teach their offspring skills of finding foods. Parents can use many methods to guide them to achieve that, for example, asking them to do some housework or clean the rooms by themselves. In my views, I agree that it is the best way for teenage children to take a part-time job to prepare their adult life for several reasons.First of all, when children get a job, they are able to earn money by themselves, instead of getting pocket money from their parents. Thus, it is an oppertunity to learn how to deal with money. Take me as an example, when I was 16, I found a job during summer vacation and earned some money by own. At the beginning of the semester, I was told to buy a text book. Unfortunately, I spent most of my salary hanging out with my friend. Therefore, I finally realized that I should learn to make a plan before I spend my money, and that did influence me in my life now.Secondly, by taking a part-time job, they certainly have to be responsible for anything they have done. For instance, if a student get a job in a company but he is frequently late for work, the company may reduce his payment or even fire him. To compare with the school life, they might suffer only a small punishment at school. Under the circumstances, he will learn that he has to obey the rule and take responsibility for their work.In conclusion, to help their children to adapt adult life, parents should let them experience it as much as they can. Due to the reasons given above, to encourage children taking a part-time job is a good choice for them to get prepared for adult life.
llm: One of the most effective ways parents can help their teenage children transition into adulthood is by encouraging them to seek part-time employment. This opportunity equips teenagers with essential skills while instilling a sense of responsibility and independence. Through part-time work, they learn crucial life skills like time management, effective communication, and teamwork.Additionally, having a job teaches teenagers about financial management. When they earn their own money, they gain an appreciation for hard work and learn to make informed choices regarding saving and spending. This experience is vital in preparing them for the financial aspects of adult life. Furthermore, working part-time exposes teenagers to a variety of career options, helping them identify their interests and strengths, which can guide their future educational and career paths.Beyond practical skills, part-time employment can significantly boost a teenager's self-esteem and confidence. Achieving success in a work environment enhances their self-image, fostering a sense of capability and self-reliance. This newfound confidence can positively influence their academic performance and overall well-being.Moreover, encouraging teens to take on part-time jobs reflects parents' trust in their abilities, which is crucial for their emotional and psychological growth. It demonstrates that parents believe in their capacity to handle responsibilities and make sound decisions, promoting a sense of autonomy and self-sufficiency.In summary, promoting part-time job opportunities for teenagers is one of the most beneficial ways parents can prepare them for adult life. It provides them with valuable skills, financial literacy, and a sense of independence and self-worth. By offering support and guidance in this journey, parents can empower their teenagers to navigate the challenges of adulthood with confidence and competence.

question: It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
human: It’s certainly better for children to grow up in a big city. Of course you need to choose a good neighborhood. I hold this belief because of two main reasons, academic and social reasons.Some people thinks that if a child grows up in a big city they will be all day at home at the computer or at the video-game, but this is not true if you live in a neighborhood with other people about your age as I did. My friends and I used to play soccer, bike, climb trees and do a lot of other stuff every day. We did play video-games, but that wasn't our main activity. In a big city there are more kinds of people and more things to do.I have a friend that grew up in the countryside. He said that he had to study a lot to pass the test to enter the university. This is another downside of growing up in the countryside. In a big city you have more qualified teachers and a better access to technology.Growing up in the countryside is not such a good experience, you won’t know a lot of people, there are gossips everywhere, and your life will be really limited. If someday I have children, I’m absolutely sure that they will grow up in a good neighborhood of a big city and they will be very happy about it.
llm: The ongoing debate regarding whether children should be raised in rural areas or large cities has captured attention for many years. While some people contend that urban settings provide greater opportunities and conveniences, I strongly believe that growing up in the countryside is far more advantageous for children.To begin with, the countryside presents a safer and healthier environment conducive to children's growth and development. With cleaner air and water, along with a slower pace of life, the risks of accidents and stress-related issues are significantly reduced. For example, children in rural areas are more likely to participate in outdoor activities like hiking and cycling, which contribute to their physical health and overall well-being. In contrast, urban living often involves dealing with pollution, noise, and congested streets, which can negatively affect a child's health.Additionally, a key benefit of rural upbringing is the stronger sense of community and social ties. In smaller towns, neighbors typically know one another and provide mutual support, creating a nurturing environment for children. This is especially important as it fosters essential social skills, including communication, empathy, and cooperation. Moreover, the countryside encourages children to connect with nature, which has been linked to improved mental health and cognitive development.In summary, although cities may offer a range of amenities and opportunities, I maintain that a rural upbringing is more beneficial for children. The healthier and safer environment, stronger community bonds, and increased interaction with nature make the countryside an ideal setting for their growth and development. Thus, I firmly advocate for the countryside as a more suitable place for children to be raised compared to a bustling city.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: I completely agree that parents are the best teacher. Children normally think that their parents are somehow special and that makes them the most important people in the children’s lives.Firstly, the things that parents say have great power to their child. More power than any friend or other adult could have. For example, if someone tells a kid that something is wrong and they shouldn't do it, but his father told him/her that it was right, the kid will listen to the father instead of the other person, even if his father is wrong.Secondly, a child normally spends more time with their parents than with other people, so their parents have more time to teach him/her than anybody else. They have more contact and more intimacy with their children. Lastly, children usually mirror themselves on their parents. That’s as important thing because even if the parents don’t intend to teach their children something, they are always observing and learning by themselves. So, if there is a man that beats his wife and treats her bad, his child probably is going to be rude and treat girls bad.All in all, I agree that parents are the greatest teachers and I think that they should be very careful with what they say and do in front of their child, because it can define who he is going to be.
llm: I wholeheartedly concur with the idea that parents are the finest teachers. From an early age, children view their parents as role models and absorb countless important lessons from them. Parents possess a distinctive ability to influence their child's personality, values, and beliefs, establishing them as the most impactful educators in a child's life.One key reason parents excel as teachers is their capacity to offer tailored guidance and support. Unlike school teachers, who must address the diverse needs of a whole classroom, parents can concentrate on their child's individual strengths, weaknesses, and preferred learning styles. For example, if a child faces challenges in a particular subject, a parent can provide personalized tutoring, helping them navigate their struggles. Furthermore, parents can equip their children with essential life skills—such as cooking, cleaning, and time management—that are crucial for fostering independence and self-reliance.Additionally, parents serve as effective teachers by offering concrete examples and hands-on experiences. Children learn through observation and imitation, and parents can utilize daily life situations to impart valuable lessons. For instance, a parent can demonstrate the importance of honesty by exemplifying it in their actions or teach the value of hard work through their dedication to supporting the family. Furthermore, parents can instill their cultural heritage, traditions, and values in their children, cultivating a strong sense of identity and belonging.In summary, parents play a crucial role in their child's education and growth. With their personalized support, practical examples, and unwavering love, parents undeniably emerge as the best teachers. They hold the remarkable ability to inspire, motivate, and guide their children, nurturing them into capable, confident, and compassionate individuals.

question: Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: The Technology has developed a lot. With that development, food can be prepared more easily and it can taste a lot better than it used to. With that change, people’s lives are a lot better for several reasons. Some good reasons are about having more time and being able to prepare better food without being a good cook.Firstly, people normally have lots of things to do. Because of that, they don’t have much time to spend in the kitchen. But being able to prepare a tasty food just putting it into the microwave or into the oven is awesome. For example, if an engineer needs to make a project, but he needs to deliver it tomorrow, he could save hours preparing a food with the microwave instead of cooking everything from scratch.Secondly, when someone wants to prepare a good food alone for some reason, some time ago he/she would need to be a very good cook to prepare that food, but nowadays is very easy to prepare a healthy and tasty food. For example, if a guy wants to prepare a dinner to his girlfriend, he could just buy some food that comes with instructions. Normally you just need to put it into the oven and wait some time.All in all, that ease to prepare food has improved people’s lives. And that happened mainly because of the development of the technology. But people should be careful with what they eat, because some industrial foods are very bad for their health, so they should buy only food from well known brands.
llm: The introduction of convenient food preparation techniques has transformed modern living. The emergence of ready-to-eat meals, microwaveable options, and meal delivery services has made cooking quicker and simpler than ever. This shift has undeniably enhanced people's lives by saving them considerable time and effort.One of the key benefits of easy food preparation is the time it frees up. In today's fast-paced environment, many individuals lead hectic lives, leaving scant time for cooking. Convenient food choices enable people to whip up a meal in no time, allowing them to focus on other important areas of their lives, such as work, family, or leisure. For example, a busy professional can now simply heat a pre-cooked meal in the microwave, enjoying a healthy dinner in just minutes.Furthermore, convenient food preparation has expanded dietary choices for those with demanding schedules. With a wide array of pre-prepared meals available, individuals can now explore various cuisines and dishes that they might not have the time or expertise to create themselves. This not only enriches their dining experiences but also introduces them to new flavors and culinary cultures. Meal delivery services further enhance this experience by allowing people to savor their favorite foods from home, thus improving their overall quality of life.In summary, the simplicity of food preparation has significantly affected how people live. By saving time, offering a diverse range of dietary options, and enriching dining experiences, convenient food preparation methods have elevated the quality of life for those with busy lifestyles. As society continues to accelerate, the significance of easy food preparation will only become more pronounced.

question: Students should be required to take regular standardized tests to prove that they are learning
human: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.Firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. For example some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue. Therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. In addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.Finally, I think that requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice, since in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students. In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively. I support the points of those who say that standardized tests are required over those who don’t because if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them.Ultimately I feel that schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right. I belive this, due to the fact that these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students.
llm: The discussion around the necessity of regular standardized testing for students has persisted for years. Some critics contend that these assessments are redundant and induce unnecessary stress, while supporters argue that they are essential for evaluating academic progress. In this essay, I will contend that students should indeed be mandated to take regular standardized tests to demonstrate their learning outcomes.To begin with, standardized tests offer an impartial and consistent way to gauge a student's grasp of specific subjects. These assessments are crafted to evaluate a student's command of essential skills and concepts, allowing educators to pinpoint areas where a student may require further help or revision. Through regular standardized testing, students can showcase their expertise in a subject and receive constructive feedback on aspects needing improvement.Moreover, standardized tests help uphold rigorous academic standards. By making these assessments compulsory, the education system ensures that all students are held to the same criteria and expectations, irrespective of their backgrounds or socioeconomic factors. This fosters equity and fairness in education, guaranteeing that every student has access to equal opportunities and resources.Additionally, standardized tests enable teachers and educators to recognize any shortcomings in their teaching methods. By scrutinizing test results, the education system can identify patterns and trends in student performance, leading to informed decisions about enhancing instruction and supporting student learning. This approach can result in more effective teaching strategies and an improved educational experience for students.In summary, regular standardized tests are an important instrument for assessing academic progress and ensuring that students meet elevated standards. They offer an objective evaluation of student comprehension, promote fairness in education, and highlight areas for instructional improvement. As such, students should be required to participate in regular standardized testing to validate their learning.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A university education should be provided free of charge to all interested scholars
human: A famous proverb “Knowledge is power” has demonstrated the value of education. I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.University is more likely to become a money making business, the issue of affordability has become crucial to the students. In today’s world education is getting expensive, and people are tending to apply for self-finance education in order to get the admission. Whereas, the scholars are facing a lot of difficulties apart from their high requirements of previous education, they has a lot to face the other difficulties and burden while getting admission such as accommodation, food, traveling, clothing, etc.Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. The idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.Therefore, universities have to look over the issues face by most of the scholars; their message should be spread education, not making money, and motivate those scholars who want to get education. Their notion should be inspirational in such a way which makes our society educative and increase our literacy rate.
llm: I firmly support the idea that university education should be offered at no cost to all aspiring students. In our contemporary knowledge-driven economy, obtaining a university degree is essential for individuals to gain the skills and expertise needed to succeed in the competitive job market. Providing free access to higher education carries significant advantages for both individuals and society.Firstly, eliminating tuition fees would enhance access to education and promote equality of opportunity. Many talented students are unable to pursue higher education due to financial limitations. By making university education free, we enable these individuals to reach their full potential and contribute positively to society. This initiative would also help narrow the divide between socioeconomic classes, fostering social mobility and diminishing income disparity.Moreover, free university education can lead to significant long-term economic gains. Educated individuals tend to have higher employment rates, earn greater incomes, and contribute more to the tax system, all of which stimulate economic growth. They are also more likely to be innovative and entrepreneurial, driving the creation of new ideas, products, and services that can further economic advancement.While some might contend that implementing free university education is prohibitively expensive and unsustainable, I contend that the long-term advantages far outweigh the associated costs. Governments could consider alternative funding strategies, such as increasing corporate taxes or introducing a wealth tax, to finance this initiative. In summary, offering free university education to all interested students is not only a moral obligation but also an economic necessity. It has the potential to foster a fairer, more innovative, and thriving society, and I strongly advocate for this policy to be pursued.

question: Some people think university professors should spend more time doing research while others think they should spend more time educating students. What is your view?Ê
human: Although professors in a university are basically teachers who do the most important thing, teaching, we cannot ignore one more influential aspect that they are always busy with, doing research. In my opinion, a professor should spend more time doing research rather than educating students for a few reasons following.A professor means a researcher or an expert of a specific science subject. He or she should always keep the passion in her field so that he or she could push him/herself forward all the time. And then he or she can do better in teaching works. For instance, the most impressive professor during my studying in university is Mr. Yang who keeps in researching and reading. He is also the one who gave us inspiration and taught us the way to study more efficient by ourselves. All of my classmates gave him a rank of AAA, the excellent teacher.As for students, we can get what we want to know from textbooks, webs or teachers. But we can only turn to our professors when we want to take part in a research and to get ourselves promoted. If a professor doesn't get any researching works, he cannot give us the opportunity. In addition, a professor who is concentrate in his or her research is thinking and creating new ideas all the time. He or she may stimulate us students to come up with some creative sugesstions. That is good for both of the professor and students.Finally, all professors in the university are fortune of the society. They are the leaders almost in every fields of science, arts, culture and so on. Without their research, there will be no new technologies come out quickly. Without their research, there will be more artcrafts being ruined by nothing. Without their research, there will be less information of our ancestors to be known on the earth.In conclusion, a professor should do their research all the time during their careers as a teacher in university. And it's worth to spend more time on it than on teaching.
llm: The role of university professors has sparked considerable discussion, with differing opinions on whether their main focus should be on research or on educating students. In my opinion, university professors should aim for a harmonious balance between these two responsibilities.On one side, conducting research is a vital component of a professor's role. It allows them to remain informed about the latest advancements in their discipline and to contribute to the broader body of knowledge. Professors engaged in research can introduce innovative ideas and perspectives into their classrooms, enhancing the relevance and engagement of their teaching. Additionally, a strong research background can bolster their credibility in the eyes of students.Conversely, the primary duty of university professors is to educate. Students attend universities to acquire knowledge, skills, and mentorship from seasoned professors. Those who prioritize teaching can provide personalized support, guidance, and mentorship, which are crucial for students' academic and personal development. Moreover, effective teaching is essential for cultivating critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills—traits that are highly sought after by employers.In summary, I believe university professors should carefully manage their time to find a balance between research and teaching. While research is important for the progression of knowledge and establishing credibility, teaching is fundamental to the growth and development of students. By effectively balancing these two roles, professors can enhance their effectiveness as educators and play a significant part in shaping the next generation of leaders and professionals. Ultimately, an equilibrium between research and teaching will yield positive outcomes for both professors and their students.

question: How do television or movies influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
human: There is no doubt that television or movies influence people’s behavior and they influence us in both bad ways and good ways. But I think in general television and movies influence our behavior in bad ways more than in good ways. They make people to eat more rubbish food, spend less time with their friends and family, and be someone that are not themselves. There are a lot of people eating foods or snacks when they are watching television. Most of the foods they eat are fat foods like chips or pizzas. It is not rocket science to know that these foods are not good for people’s health. Many companies know about this behavior and use advertisements on television to make people buy more of these foods. In turn, people will consume these rubbish foods more and we have to deal with a lot of fat diseases.Television and movies also make people to spend more time on their couch than with their family and friends, especially children. They communicate less with their parents because a lot of their time is used watching television and movies. When people are watching television or movies together, they also talk less to each other, compare to when playing social games, such as parlor games, together.Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they don’t prefer it.I think television and movies are entertaining but most of the time they influence people’s behavior in bad ways. If you want to stay healthy, be yourself and spend time with your family and friends, then you should spend less time watching these media.
llm: The impact of television and film on human behavior is a complex and significant topic. These media forms possess the capacity to influence our attitudes, values, and actions in powerful ways. One key aspect of this influence is the emotional bonds we develop with characters and narratives, which can motivate us to embrace new behaviors and perspectives. For instance, films like "Erin Brockovich" and "The Pursuit of Happyness" inspire audiences to take a stand against social injustices or to persist through challenging times.Moreover, the depiction of various lifestyles or behaviors as appealing can also drive this influence. Many TV shows and movies showcase characters engaging in risky or unhealthy activities—such as substance abuse or reckless driving—creating a possibility for viewers, especially the younger generations, to mimic these actions. On the flip side, media can also advocate for positive behaviors, like environmental consciousness and healthy eating, by presenting characters that embody these ideals.In addition, films and television can sway our buying habits and consumer behaviors. Through product placements and advertisements woven into the storyline, viewers can develop a desire for specific products or brands, which often leads to increased consumerism. For example, the success of the "Mission: Impossible" franchise has been associated with a rise in sales of gadgets and apparel featured in the series.In summary, the effect of television and movies on individual behavior is a nuanced and far-reaching issue. Through emotional connections, depictions of aspirational behaviors, and strategic marketing, media can significantly influence our attitudes, values, and actions. As media consumers, it's crucial to recognize these influences and critically assess the messages and values being presented. By doing so, we can maximize the positive aspects of media as sources of inspiration and education while reducing their potential negative effects.

question: Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
human: Many people like to visit museums when they travel to new places, other people don't like to visit museums. I personaly tend to visit museums when I'm in a new place because it's good for me know about the culture, tradition and history of other places.The first reason why people are willing to visit museums when they travel to a new territory is that museums provide a tremendous amount of information about different aspects of the history and culture of that place, as I said back. And also taking the chance for making friends. Visit museums can bring you the opportunity to establish relations and knowledge to participate in conversations. And that kind of knowledge speaks very highly of you.However, other people visit museums are the most boring expirience of a trip. My cousin Pedro literaly hates to visit museums but he really enjoyed his visit to the famous London - Madame Tussaud museum, it was kind of art entertainment but also that visit helped him to understand the artist works, and in addition he started to respect and admire other types of arts that offers in other museums.In coclusion, the museums are a visual source to know the history, tradition and culture of any place in the world. I think it's fun and educational.
llm: When exploring new destinations, many travelers find it common to visit museums. In my view, there are several compelling reasons for this. First and foremost, museums offer a unique chance to delve into the history and culture of the area. By examining exhibits and artifacts, visitors can gain invaluable insights into local customs, traditions, and lifestyles. For example, the Louvre Museum in Paris provides a glimpse into French art and history, while the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City presents an extensive collection of American and European artworks.Another significant reason for museum visits is the appreciation of artistic and architectural wonders. Museums frequently house iconic paintings, sculptures, and masterpieces celebrated around the globe. The Uffizi Gallery in Florence, Italy, is particularly renowned for its stunning collection of Renaissance art, featuring works by artists like Botticelli and Leonardo da Vinci. Visitors can admire the artistry and craftsmanship behind these pieces, which deepens their understanding and appreciation of art.Finally, museums create opportunities to engage with the local community and connect with like-minded individuals. Many museums offer guided tours, workshops, and interactive exhibits that encourage dialogue and learning among attendees. This social dimension of visiting museums allows individuals to bond with others who share similar passions, enhancing the overall experience. In summary, people visit museums to educate themselves about local culture, appreciate artistic masterpieces, and interact with the community. This makes museums an integral part of any travel itinerary, enriching their understanding and appreciation of the destinations they explore while creating lasting memories.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: In a busy and crowded world, we should not expect people to be polite to others.
human: Once a celebrity said: A man's manner is a mirror that reflects his virtues. Recently, the social environment we lived with busy noises and crowded spaces in case that people pay less attentions on their behaviors and manners. They are being rude towards others. Due to this phenomenon, someone suggests that we should not expect people to be polite to other. Obviously, I do not agree with such kind of altitudes, the explanations I explored would be stated as following.First of all, a person with good manner will give others a fine personal impression. Through those impressions, a person was easily to get acquired with others and blended with the community that surrounded him as soon as possible. For example, I worked in a new company, if I am a guy with good manners and treating everyone well, my new colleagues will accept me, even then I will be approved by the employers. In opposite situation if I am being rude, I can not get along well with each other. Finally, I will be fired and have no other choice but lost my job.Secondly, people will get respect from politeness within each other. Politeness and tender words not only can help the speaker to earn a good reputation but also that encourage the listeners who were in need. A successful corporation must have a relationship with respect and pleasure. There are many more facts have improved that people with politeness are easily to be succeed, because from their behaviors, they made their partners or opponents to find their own individual dignity.Finally, the society needs a civilized environment and orders. And a degree of social civilization depend on its people's qualities. In order to create a better living environment for ourselves and our offsprings, our behaviors must be asked with politeness and good manners. Benefit from those effective measures, there may be an obvious effect on the reducing of criminal rate.All in all, I suppose that people should be polite to others in a such busy and crowded world.
llm: I disagree with the notion that, in a hectic and bustling world, we should not anticipate politeness from others. While the rapid pace of modern life can indeed lead to stress and impatience, I contend that courtesy is crucial in such settings. Politeness extends beyond mere pleasantries; it embodies respect and consideration for those around us. In crowded environments, where we frequently encounter strangers, simple gestures of politeness—like saying "excuse me" or "thank you”—can significantly enhance our interactions, making them more pleasant and harmonious.Moreover, exhibiting politeness can alleviate stress and tension during busy moments. Courteous exchanges can foster a sense of calm and civility, even amid chaos. For instance, a friendly conversation with a stranger on a crowded train or bus can transform an uncomfortable journey into a more enjoyable experience. Conversely, a lack of politeness can spark conflict and aggression, heightening the stress and anxiety associated with crowded surroundings.In summary, I firmly believe that politeness is vital in a fast-paced world. It is not a luxury we can afford to overlook; rather, it is a necessity that enriches our interactions. By practicing politeness, we contribute to a more positive and respectful environment, even in the most crowded and chaotic settings. As such, we should continue to expect and encourage politeness from others and strive to embody it ourselves, regardless of the situation.

question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Most experiences in our lives that seemed difficult at the time become valuable lessons for the future. Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
human: There is a famous old saying that failure is the mother of success. For that reason, some people advocate that some difficulties people met at their early ages will become an invaluable fortune in their future lives. However, some people think it isn't supposed to be that case. From my point of view, I am in favor the former statement that some tough experiences people met before will be helpful in their life path.To start with, hardship makes people realize how to cherish and compliment the common but wonderful little things happened in their life such as, a shining weather, a delicious breakfast and etc. People who have such nice spirit usually know how to find the true love in their life instead of being seduced by greed as to lose themselves in the end. As a result, experiences of difficulties teach them how to keep a nice mood and have confidence all the time.What's more, people who experienced lots of difficulties will be calmer when they are in troubles. Because they already have such experiences of overcoming some difficulties, they are conscious of what to do and how to do when fierce crisis happens. Those people are more likely to achieve their ambitions in their career because they are aware of how to lead people to reach success despite what kind of difficulties are getting in their way.So, to sum it up, both not afraid of difficulties and appreciating common but pleasant things in their lives drive me to believe that most tough experiences in people's life path will be a priceless treasure to them. Remember if you are afraid of encountering difficulties, then you will be in the troubles all the time.
llm: I wholeheartedly believe that many of the experiences in our lives that feel challenging at the moment ultimately become significant lessons for the future. Each difficult situation we face leaves a lasting imprint on our personal and professional development. These experiences provide us with invaluable insights that we can utilize in similar scenarios down the line, thereby sharpening our decision-making and problem-solving skills.Take, for example, the disappointment of failing a job interview. While it can be a tough experience, it also offers a chance to reflect on our strengths and weaknesses, allowing us to better prepare for future opportunities. Similarly, a painful breakup may leave us feeling emotionally exhausted, yet it teaches us essential lessons about self-love, respect, and the importance of establishing boundaries in relationships. Such insights are crucial as they help us navigate life's complexities with greater confidence and ease.Additionally, many accomplished individuals credit their achievements to the difficult experiences they've endured. Consider J.K. Rowling, the celebrated author of the Harry Potter series, who was a single mother relying on welfare when she first began writing. Her hardships and struggles inspired her to create a literary phenomenon that has captivated millions around the globe. This illustrates how challenging experiences can be transformed into powerful lessons that propel us toward our aspirations.In summary, the tough moments we endure often turn out to be invaluable lessons for the future. They provide us with the wisdom, resilience, and determination necessary to conquer obstacles and achieve our goals. By embracing these experiences and learning from them, we can profoundly change our lives and build a brighter, more promising future.

question: Life in a city is much better than life in the countryside
human: As far as I am concerned, I agree with the statement that life in a city is much better than life in the countryside.Firstly, in the city there is much better education system. This means, that the schools and the universities have well equipped classes and the famous professors would like to work in such places.In addition, I believe that city provides more work opportunities than the countryside. There are not only more jobs, but they are also well-paid. Of course living in a city is more expensive, but incomes are higher too.Moreover, in the urban areas there are also more citizens what means, that the culture diversity is huge. Meeting and knowing new people's tradition is an unforgettable experience, which could influence on one's previous habits.Furthermore, the city has well-organised lines of transport. The buses and trains are more frequent than in the countryside, so the city provides better communication.However, in the countryside there are many places to rest, because of its location. Moreover, peaceful and close to the nature areas could help to avoid worries and sadness.Taking all into account, I think that living in the city is much better nowadays, because of the opportunities it gives. Today living in the rural places is in most causes connected with agrarian lifestyle, which for me is without perspective. If I could decide I would chose living in the city for sure.
llm: The discussion about whether city living is superior to rural life has persisted for years. Some individuals cherish the tranquility and charm of the countryside, while others contend that urban environments present more opportunities and benefits. Personally, I believe that living in a city is far more advantageous than residing in the countryside.To begin with, cities offer superior job prospects and higher earnings. Unlike rural locales, urban areas serve as centers for businesses, industries, and corporations, providing a plethora of career paths. Furthermore, cities boast well-established infrastructure, including transportation networks, healthcare facilities, and educational institutions, facilitating easy access to essential services.
